title: The Silver Flame
data:
**The Silver Flame** is a lawfully aligned [cult](/wiki/Cult_\(dNetHack\) "Cult (dNetHack)") in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Location](#Location)

- [2 Sacrificing](#Sacrificing)

- [3 Silver Flame boons](#Silver_Flame_boons)

  - [3.1 List of minor boons](#List_of_minor_boons)
  - [3.2 List of major boons](#List_of_major_boons)

- [4 Messages](#Messages)

## Location

The Silver Flame is always located in the main branch of the dungeon, and can be sought out by [applying](/wiki/Apply "Apply") a [mirror](/wiki/Mirror "Mirror") at yourself while at over 20 [insight](/wiki/Insight "Insight"): doing so will report the location of a "silver light", depending on where you are relevant to the cult:

- If you are not on the same floor, it will report the location as (far) below or above you.
- If you are on the correct dungeon level, it will instead report the cardinal direction of a specific square on that floor, e.g. "far to the west".
- If you are on the correct square, you can then follow the directions below to begin following the Silver Flame.

## Sacrificing

To begin following the Silver Flame, you must have a suitable [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") or pair of [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves"). The Silver Flame can only take up residence in suitable [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril"), [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") and [platinum](/wiki/Platinum "Platinum") objects - once it does so, your mirror will be converted to a purified mirror, which appears as a silver disk when unidentified. The Silver Flame-enhanced object will have "shining" prepended to their material, e.g. "shining mithril".

Vanquishing certain monsters with a Silver Flame weapon has a chance of instantly sacrificing that monster to the Flame, preventing them from leaving a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"); their inventory will be dropped as normal. A successful sacrifice this way [angers](/wiki/Anger "Anger") any non-lawful deity, unless you are a [Binder](/wiki/Binder "Binder"), [Anachrononaut](/wiki/Anachrononaut "Anachrononaut") or an unaligned [Madman](/wiki/Madman "Madman") - wearing a [helm of opposite alignment](/wiki/Helm_of_opposite_alignment "Helm of opposite alignment") to become lawful and sacrificing to the Silver Flame does not anger your god.

Care must be taken not to accidentally kill monsters in shops (particularly [mimics](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic")) this way, as you will be charged for the destroyed corpse.

## Silver Flame boons

Every sacrifice increases your standing with the Silver Flame in the form of flame credits, which are not reported to the player. You can consult the silver flame by applying your silver disk: if there are not enough flame credits, nothing happens and [a message](#Messages) is printed. Otherwise, a menu of boons is displayed for you to select.

Consulting the Silver Flame and applying its boons does not break the [atheism](/wiki/Atheism "Atheism") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").

### List of minor boons

| Boon                              | Cost | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| --------------------------------- | ---- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Smelt away impurity               | 50   | Sets any metallic object's material to silver                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Smelt away imperfection           | 50   | Sets any metallic object's material to platinum                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| Smelt away immobility             | 50   | Sets any metallic object's material to mithril                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Spread the reflected silver flame | 25   | Imbues any suitable weapon, pair of gloves or mirror with the Silver Flame. This is identical to the effects of the first weapon sanctified, granting it an object property that sacrifices certain slain monsters to the Silver Flame. |
| Burn aura                         | 10   | Unblesses and uncurses an item.                                                                                                                                                                                                         |

### List of major boons

This only becomes available once your total accumulated credit reaches a specific level.

| Boon                                   | Cost | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| -------------------------------------- | ---- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Mirror-finish a surface                | 50   | Applies reflection to any suitable armor or weapon                                                                                                                                                                     |
| Burn on a curse-proof glaze            | 25   | Applies 1‚ÅÑ5 curse resistance to any suitable armor. Can be applied to weapons, but does not do anything.                                                                                                               |
| Focus the light to reveal mortality    | 50   | Applies the ability to drain 1d2 levels from attacked monsters to gloves/boots/weapon.                                                                                                                                 |
| Focus the light to reveal true death   | 50   | Applies double damage + 2d7 against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") to gloves/boots/weapon.                                                                                                                            |
| Focus the light to reveal the unworthy | 50   | Applies double damage to minions (including angels and other spiritual beings) and demons as disintegration damage to gloves/boots/weapon. Worn artifacts and disintegration-proof armor on the target are unaffected. |

## Messages

- \<monster> burns from within, consumed by silver fire!

  A monster was killed by a Silver Flame weapon.

- The silver flame is distant and uninterested.

  You applied your silver disk, but did not have enough flame credits.

The Silver Flame is a lawfully aligned cult in dNetHack.

Contents

  • 2 Sacrificing

Location

The Silver Flame is always located in the main branch of the dungeon, and can be sought out by applying a mirror at yourself while at over 20 insight: doing so will report the location of a "silver light", depending on where you are relevant to the cult:

  • If you are on the correct square, you can then follow the directions below to begin following the Silver Flame.

To begin following the Silver Flame, you must have a suitable weapon or pair of gloves. The Silver Flame can only take up residence in suitable mithril, silver and platinum objects - once it does so, your mirror will be converted to a purified mirror, which appears as a silver disk when unidentified. A successful sacrifice this way angers any non-lawful deity, unless you are a Binder, Anachrononaut or an unaligned Madman - wearing a helm of opposite alignment to become lawful and sacrificing to the Silver Flame does not anger your god.

Care must be taken not to accidentally kill monsters in shops (particularly mimics) this way, as you will be charged for the destroyed corpse.

Silver Flame boons

Every sacrifice increases your standing with the Silver Flame in the form of flame credits, which are not reported to the player. You can consult the silver flame by applying your silver disk: if there are not enough flame credits, nothing happens and a message is printed. Otherwise, a menu of boons is displayed for you to select.

Consulting the Silver Flame and applying its boons does not break the atheism conduct.
